captions.text:
Boo muthafu**a! It’s Halloween and
this week I’m sinking these bad boys in
yo momma with Dracula by Bram Stoker.

Now the story of my boy Drac ain’t
told like most cuz we gettin the beat on this

blood-suckin playa from a bunch of letters
and other scribbles.

It all start when Jonathan Harker
arrive in Transylvania to take care of some

bidness. But when the local po folk hear he
headin to the phat crib of Count Dracula,
they all start wiggin OUT.

On the real, the count seem like yo regular
uptown gangsta...until John
cuts himself shaving...

Oh sh**! When John start
recognizin’ dat Castle Dracula is bout the

craziest damn place he ever seen, he like
“I gotta get my white ass outta here.”

Later Harker’s woman Mina headin
out to visit her homegirl Lucy. And this dip’s

milkshake bringin ALL da boys to the yard.
But since two of em just scrubs, she decide
to get down with Arthur.

sh** gets REAL creepy when some
hoopty-ass boat from Castle Dracula gets WRECKED
on shore.

The only things left are 50 boxes
of dirt, a big-ass pooch that up and disappears,
and a dead body strapped to the ship.

One night Lucy start sleepwalkin
like she do and Mina follows her to a graveyard

where some hood-ass playa gettin all up in
her sh**. Dat mystery-brutha disappear leavin

two bite marks on Lucy’s neck and now she
gettin’ sick as hell. So Seward hit up his

old teach Van Helsing who take one look at
her crusty ass and like “Yeah. something’s

fu**ed up right here.” To save her, Van
Helsing, Seward, Quincy, and Arthur straight

open a vein for this broad. But dat ain’t
do a damn thing, and she dies.

When Van Helsing hear dat some
crazy crackhead been bustin up lil kids, he

goes to Lucy’s boy-toys and drops a bomb
on they asses: They need to merc Lucy AGAIN

cuz she’s become a vampire. After tearin
dat bitch up, Van Helsing’s boys crew up

with Mina and John to go after da big dawg
himself- Count D.

But before they can make a move,
Dracula gets the jump on Mina, makes her sip

some of his vampire joose, and now she one
step closer to goin out like Lucy.

Our boys only hope of savin Mina is
to ice the big D, and the only way to do dat

is to sniff out erry one of his dirt-nap boxes
and take dem bitches OUT. Dracula trucks his

pasty ass back to Transylvania, and eventually
Van Helsing and the gang catch up to him and
SHANK dat sucka.

So when Mina and John have
themselves a lil G of they own, they name

him after the whole crew and call him Quincey
since their boy went down fighting the big
D.

Even though a blood sucking white
boy sounds scurry to this thug, dat ain’t

all dat was makin dem Victorians piss themselves-
to them, the real monster was seein a sexually
liberated woman doin her thang.

Dat girl Lucy’s the perfect example
of what put skid marks in the Victorian’s

drawers: Not only is she so fly dat she got
three horn dogs hollerin at dat ass, but she’s

also exchangin fluids with four dudes on the
DL!

And what’s the problem when a
woman’s sexuality is let off da chain? The

tight-ass image of the Victorian mother falls
to sh**. And we see a sexy

vampire Lucy straight TOSSIN BABIES. And if
they can’t control her, they gotta kill her.

And to this G, thats’s one of the
reasons they able to save Mina: She the true,

blue Victorian wifey who just wanna help her
hubby out.

But dat ain’t all, B. One of da
reasons this book continues to scare bruthas

today is cuz Dracula always remindin us dat
things may not be what they seem.

Dracula may talk real fancy and be
decked out in sweet swag like yo average rich

Victorian, but he really a Stone Cold, blood-chuggin
Gangsta. You can’t judge a book by its cover, man.

And in a society that’s so set on
breakin a brutha down just by lookin at em,

there ain’t nothin mo scary than someone
who defies stereotypes. NAW MEAN?

Wanna see, hear, and understand?
Then hit dat subscribe button, yo. Catch y’all
lata. Peace.

comments.author: Angie M.

comments.text:
After watching this video for the 10th time, I can safely say that it is in 
itself a piece of satirical literature. Here we have a gentleman who plays 
the role of a thug and gangster; putting himself in the role of his 
stereotype to bring use some fine-ass literary analysis and who most us 
naturally assume is in real life just like the character he plays. That's 
why count dracula's photograph in the animation is replaced with his own... 
He is also making the comment that although many people might think he is a 
real thug, he's probably just a regular dude playing a role; making all of 
our stereotypes invalid.

Thats goddamn genius.﻿

comments.author: Arun P

comments.text:
One other interpretation. Dracula is the invading "other." He's the foreign 
"low class" non white, non Victorian alien from another country coming to 
invade the perfect English world... but his lack of class and intelligence 
makes him vulnerable to the thinking, logical men of the English world. 
That's why he loses.

Just some thoughts from an English professor. =D

Great stuff here though. I love Dracula. But I'm surprised you completely 
left out Renfield! Oh well. XD﻿

comments.text:
It caught my eye that in 1:00 the picture used for one of Lucy's man candy, 
Quincy Morris, is actually a picture of Paul Mounet, who I know because of 
that odd theory that Keanu Reeves is immortal (google it). So Keanu Reeves, 
who played Johnathan Harker in 1992 Bram Stoker's Dracula, is theorized to 
be Paul Mounet, who shows up in this review of Dracula... Just the first 
thing that came to mind.﻿

the annual Nobel winner? This year Patrick Modiano? (I think three months 
from announcement to speech might be enough time to get through whatever 
the Swedes pick each year) Seems like a nice way to link classical lit 
lovers to modern works.﻿
